Press-Enterprise (California)|The Press-Enterprise]] |date=June 9, 2011 |accessdate=July 30, 2011 |first=Timothy |last=Guy |url=http://www.pe.com/local-news/local-news-headlines/20110610-disneys-magic-undergoes-changes.ece |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131120063827/http://www.pe.com/local-news/local-news-headlines/20110610-disneys-magic-undergoes-changes.ece |archivedate=November 20, 2013 }} ===Home media=== The film was released on DVD and Blu-Ray on September 12, 2011 in the UK, topping both the Blu-ray and DVD sales charts during its first two weeks. The film had its high-definition home release on October 18, 2011 in the United States and Canada. Three different physical packages were made available: a 2-disc combo pack (Blu-ray and DVD), a 5-disc combo pack (2-disc Blu-ray, 1-disc Blu-ray 3D, 1-disc DVD, and 1-disc Digital Copy), and a 15-disc collection featuring all four ''Pirates'' movies. ''On Stranger Tides'' was also released as a movie download in both high definition and 3D.{{cite news|title=Exclusive Clip: 'Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides' Mermaid Magic |url=http://www.etonline.com/movies/112349_Exclusive_Clip_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean_On_Stranger_Tides_Mermaid_Magic/index.html |accessdate=July 14, 2011 |work=[[Entertainment Tonight]] |date=July 13, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120926021855/http://www.etonline.com/movies/112349_Exclusive_Clip_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean_On_Stranger_Tides_Mermaid_Magic/index.html |archivedate=September 26, 2012 }}{{cite news|last=Smith |first=Matthew |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides Blu-ray and Blu-ray 3D |url=http://www.blu-ray.com/news/?id=6864 |accessdate=July 14, 2011 |publisher=Blu-Ray.com |date=July 14, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120406172340/http://www.blu-ray.com/news/?id=6864 |archivedate=April 6, 2012 }}{{cite news|last=McCutcheon |first=David |title=Pirates' Stranger Tides Revealed |url=http://dvd.ign.com/articles/118/1182102p1.html |accessdate=July 14, 2011 |publisher=Blu-Ray.com |date=July 14, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120603023240/http://dvd.ign.com/articles/118/1182102p1.html |archivedate=June 3, 2012 }} The regular DVD edition came out on December 6.{{cite news|last=Grabert |first=Jessica |title=Disney Will Delay Pirates Of The Caribbean DVD For A Month After Blu-Ray |url=http://www.cinemablend.com/new/Disney-Will-Delay-Pirates-Of-The-Caribbean-DVD-For-A-Month-After-Blu-Ray-25716.html |accessdate=August 1, 2011 |publisher=Cinema Blend |date=July 15, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121017210512/http://www.cinemablend.com/new/Disney-Will-Delay-Pirates-Of-The-Caribbean-DVD-For-A-Month-After-Blu-Ray-25716.html |archivedate=October 17, 2012 }} In its first week of release, it sold 1.71 million Blu-ray units and generated $48.50 million, topping the weekly Blu-ray chart. However these results were quite skewed due to the one-month delay of its DVD-only release.{{cite news|title=Blu-ray Sales: Strange Week on the Home Market |url=http://www.the-numbers.com/interactive/newsStory.php?newsID=6731 |date=November 2, 2011 |accessdate=November 17, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130522133928/http://www.the-numbers.com/interactive/newsStory.php?newsID=6731 |archivedate=May 22, 2013 }} It sold 3.20 million Blu-ray units ($83.46 million) after 11 weeks.{{cite news|title=Weekly Domestic Blu-ray Sales Chart for Week Ending January 1, 2012 |url=http://www.the-numbers.com/weekly-bluray-sales-chart |accessdate=January 11, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140605021612/http://www.the-numbers.com/weekly-bluray-sales-chart |archivedate=June 5, 2014 |df= }} It has also sold 1.12 million DVD units ($19.32 million).{{cite news|title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides – DVD Sales |url=http://www.the-numbers.com/movies/2011/PIRT4-DVD.php |accessdate=January 11, 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130820095937/http://www.the-numbers.com/movies/2011/PIRT4-DVD.php |archivedate=August 20, 2013 }} Upon its television premiere on December 29, 2013 in the UK on [[BBC One]], it was watched by a total of 5.4 million viewers, making it the third-most watched program that night, according to overnight figures.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/news/a540847/pirates-of-the-caribbean-on-stranger-tides-thrills-54m-on-bbc-one.html |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides thrills 5.4m on BBC One |work=Digital Spy |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140309153405/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/news/a540847/pirates-of-the-caribbean-on-stranger-tides-thrills-54m-on-bbc-one.html |archivedate=March 9, 2014 }} ==Reception== ===Box office=== ''On Stranger Tides'' earned $241.1 million in the North America and $804.6 million in other countries for a worldwide total of $1.045 billion.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=piratesofthecaribbean4.htm |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=November 11, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130425015645/http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=piratesofthecaribbean4.htm |archivedate=April 25, 2013 }} It is the [[List of highest-grossing films|23rd highest-grossing film worldwide]], the [[2011 in film|third-highest-grossing 2011 film]], the second-most successful installment of the [[Pirates of the Caribbean (film series)|''Pirates of the Caribbean'' series]], the eleventh-highest-grossing [[Walt Disney Pictures|Disney]] feature and the third highest-grossing fourth film in a franchise (behind ''[[Jurassic World]]'' and ''[[Transformers: Age of Extinction]]'').{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/alltime/world/ |title=WORLDWIDE GROSSES |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=April 23, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130726070111/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/alltime/world/ |archivedate=July 26, 2013 }} On its worldwide opening weekend, it grossed $350.6 million, surpassing ''At World's End''{{'}}s $344 million opening as best in the series and ranking as the seventh-highest worldwide opening.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/alltime/world/worldwideopenings.htm |title=WORLDWIDE OPENINGS |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130801031300/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/alltime/world/worldwideopenings.htm |archivedate=August 1, 2013 }} It scored an [[IMAX]] worldwide opening-weekend record with $16.7 million{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/pirates-box-office-opens-3464-191018 |title=Box Office Report: Disney's 'Pirates' $346 million Opening Fourth Biggest Worldwide Debut Ever |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=May 22, 2011 |accessdate=May 22, 2011 |first=Pamela |last=McClintock |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65z8m8Blv?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/pirates-box-office-opens-3464-191018 |archivedate=March 7, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} (first surpassed by ''[[Transformers: Dark of the Moon]]'').{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-report-transformers-dark-207883 |title=Box Office Report: 'Transformers: Dark of the Moon' Scores Third-Best Global Bow Ever |date=July 3, 2011 |first=Pamela |last=McClintock |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=July 3, 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65zCHZbe2?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-report-transformers-dark-207883 |archivedate=March 7, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} It set records for the least time to reach $500, $600, and $700 million worldwide (in 10, 12 and 16 days, respectively).{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-report-warner-bros-192776 |title=Friday Box Office: 'Hangover 2' No. 1 With $30 Mil |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |first=Pamela |last=McClintock |date=May 27, 2011 |accessdate=May 28, 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65zCUwEUH?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-report-warner-bros-192776 |archivedate=March 7, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3176&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World Brief: 'Pirates' Booty Grows, 'Hangover,' 'Panda' Sequels Open Strongly |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |first=Gray |last=Brandon |date=May 29, 2011 |accessdate=May 30, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511161846/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3176&p=.htm |archivedate=May 11, 2013 }}{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-report-pirates-caribbean-194751 |title=Box Office Report: 'Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides' Sails Past $700 Mil Mark |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |first=Pamela |last=McClintock |date=June 3, 2011 |accessdate=June 4, 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65zCbaPUK?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-report-pirates-caribbean-194751 |archivedate=March 7, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} The first of these records was first surpassed by ''Dark of the Moon''{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3203&p=.htm |title='Transformers' Blowing Up Worldwide Records |publisher=Box Office Mojo |first=Subers |last=Ray |date=July 8, 2011 |accessdate=July 31, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130514220603/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3203&p=.htm |archivedate=May 14, 2013 }} and the other two by ''[[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2]]''.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3222&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World Roundup: 'Potter' Still Magic Overseas |publisher=Box Office Mojo |first=Subers |last=Ray |date=July 26, 2011 |accessdate=July 31, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511162929/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3222&p=.htm |archivedate=May 11, 2013 }} After 46 days in theaters (July 2, 2011), it became the eighth film in cinema history and the fourth film released by Walt Disney Studios to cross the $1-billion-mark.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/07/02/us-pirates-idUSTRE7611NC20110702 |title="Pirates" treasure mounts to $1 billion worldwide |publisher=Reuters |date=July 2, 2011 |accessdate=November 18, 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65zCi0PSZ?url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/07/02/us-pirates-idUSTRE7611NC20110702 |archivedate=March 7, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} It set a record for the fastest Disney-distributed film to reach the milestone (first surpassed by ''[[The Avengers (2012 film)|Marvel's The Avengers]]''){{cite news|last=Corliss |first=Richard |title=The Avengers Storms the Billion Dollar Club—in Just 19 Days |url=http://entertainment.time.com/2012/05/13/the-avengers-storms-the-billion-dollar-club-in-just-19-days/ |accessdate=May 13, 2012 |newspaper=Time |date=May 13, 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130521165524/http://entertainment.time.com/2012/05/13/the-avengers-storms-the-billion-dollar-club-in-just-19-days/ |archivedate=May 21, 2013 }} and it is the fifth-fastest film overall to achieve this.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3234&p=.htm |title='Transformers' Becomes Tenth Billion-Dollar Movie Ever; 'Potter' Hits Another Worldwide Milestone |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=October 1, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130516023415/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3234&p=.htm |archivedate=May 16, 2013 }} ====North America==== During its Thursday-midnight showings, ''On Stranger Tides'' earned $4.7 million from 2,210 theaters,{{cite news|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3166&p=.htm |title=Forecast: 'Pirates' Has Some Life Left in It |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |date=May 20, 2011 |accessdate=May 21, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512065142/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3166&p=.htm |archivedate=May 12, 2013 }} and $34,860,549 in total on its opening day.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=piratesofthecaribbean4.htm |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=May 28, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130425015645/http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=piratesofthecaribbean4.htm |archivedate=April 25, 2013 }} It earned $90.2 million on its opening weekend, topping the weekend box office, but earning much less than its two immediate predecessors (''At World's End'' – $114.7 million and ''Dead Man's Chest'' – $135.6 million) and the directly preceding [[Johnny Depp]] spectacle (''[[Alice in Wonderland (2010 film)|Alice in Wonderland]]'' – $116.1 million).{{cite news|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3169&p=.htm |title=Weekend Report: 'Pirates' Rides Smaller 'Tides' |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |first=Brandon |last=Gray |date=May 23, 2011 |accessdate=November 11, 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511161408/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3169&p=.htm |archivedate=May 11, 2013 }} 3D showings accounted for only 46% of its opening-weekend gross.{{cite web|url=http://insidemovies.ew.com/2011/05/25/pirates-caribbean-stranger-tides-3d-box-office/ |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/60niUpApS?url=http://insidemovies.ew.com/2011/05/25/pirates-caribbean-stranger-tides-3d-box-office/ |archivedate=August 9, 2011 |title='Pirates of the Caribbean': Why didn't more American moviegoers opt to see Jack Sparrow in 3-D? |work=Entertainment Weekly |first=John |last=Young |accessdate=July 31, 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }} It closed on September 29, 2011, with a $241.1 million gross, ranking as the fifth-highest-grossing film of 2011{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/yearly/chart/?yr=2011&p=.htm |title=2011 DOMESTIC GROSSES |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=October 1, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130501035921/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/yearly/chart/?yr=2011&p=.htm |archivedate=May 1, 2013 }} and the least profitable film of the franchise.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/franchises/chart/?id=piratesofthecaribbean.htm |title=Pirates of the Caribbean Movies at the Box Office |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=August 14, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130425023334/http://boxofficemojo.com/franchises/chart/?id=piratesofthecaribbean.htm |archivedate=April 25, 2013 }} However, it was the top-grossing movie during May 2011 (with $166.8 million by May 31).{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3181&p=.htm |title=May Posts Record Gross |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=October 2, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511214320/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3181&p=.htm |archivedate=May 11, 2013 }} ====Outside North America==== Outside North America, ''On Stranger Tides'' is the sixth-highest-grossing film,{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/alltime/world/?pagenum=1&sort=osgross&order=DESC&p=.htm |title=All Time Worldwide Box Office Grosses |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510005915/http://boxofficemojo.com/alltime/world/?pagenum=1&sort=osgross&order=DESC&p=.htm |archivedate=May 10, 2013 }} the third-highest-grossing Disney film,{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-shocker-pirates-caribbean-202030 |title=Box Office Shocker: 'Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides' Is Disney's Top Film of All Time Overseas |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=June 15, 2011 |accessdate=June 16, 2011 |first=Pamela |last=McClintock |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65zCyJept?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-shocker-pirates-caribbean-202030 |archivedate=March 7, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} the second-highest-grossing 2011 film and the highest-grossing film of the ''Pirates of the Caribbean'' series.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/weekend/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |title=2011 Overseas Total Yearly Box Office Results |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121119075532/http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/weekend/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |archivedate=November 19, 2012 }} It is the highest-grossing ''Pirates'' film in at least 58 territories. During its opening day (Wednesday, May 18, 2011), ''On Stranger Tides'' made $18.5 million from 10 territories.{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/pirates-caribbean-earns-185-million-190286 |title='Pirates of the Caribbean' Earns $18.5 Million Internationally |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=May 19, 2011 |accessdate=May 19, 2011 |first=Frank |last=Segers |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65zD4mTX3?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/pirates-caribbean-earns-185-million-190286 |archivedate=March 7, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} It added 37 territories and $25.7 million on Thursday, for a two-day total of $44.2 million,{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/pirates-caribbean-opens-47-million-190672 |title='Pirates of the Caribbean' Opens to $4.7 Million at Midnight Showings |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=May 20, 2011 |accessdate=May 20, 2011 |first=Pamela |last=McClintock |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65zDBE7g4?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/pirates-caribbean-opens-47-million-190672 |archivedate=March 7, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} and on Friday, it expanded to almost all countries, earning $46.2 million for a three-day total of $92.1 million.{{cite news|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3167&p=.htm |title='Pirates' Already Making Waves Overseas |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |date=May 20, 2011 |accessdate=May 20, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130515105240/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3167&p=.htm |archivedate=May 15, 2013 }} On its five-day opening weekend as a whole, it earned a then-record $260.4 million from 18,210 screens in more than 100 territories, in all which it reached first place at the box office.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?page=intl&view=byweekend&id=piratesofthecaribbean4.htm |title=PIRATES OF THE CARIBBEAN: ON STRANGER TIDES |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=June 5, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121023072001/http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?page=intl&view=byweekend&id=piratesofthecaribbean4.htm |archivedate=October 23, 2012 }} The record debut was surpassed later in the same summer season by ''Deathly Hallows Part 2''.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/weekend/opening/ |title=OVERSEAS TOTAL ALL TIME OPENINGS |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508201519/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/intl/weekend/opening/ |archivedate=May 8, 2013 }} Earnings originating from 3-D showings accounted for 66% of the weekend gross, which was a much greater share than in North America. Its highest-grossing countries during its first weekend were Russia and the CIS ($31.42 million including previews),{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/intl/cis/?yr=2011&wk=20&p=new |title=Russia – CIS Box Office May 19–22, 2011 |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=December 31, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160305210208/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/intl/cis/?yr=2011&wk=20&p=new |archivedate=March 5, 2016 }} China ($22.3 million){{cite web|url=http://english.entgroup.cn/370427/|title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides|publisher=EntGroup|accessdate=April 15, 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140415161258/http://english.entgroup.cn/370427/|archivedate=April 15, 2014}} and Germany ($20.53 million).{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/intl/germany/?yr=2011&wk=20&p=.htm |title=Germany Box Office May 19–22, 2011 |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=December 31, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111114165102/http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/germany/?yr=2011&wk=20&p=.htm |archivedate=November 14, 2011 }}{{cite news|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3170&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World Roundup: 'Pirates' Sails to New Overseas Record |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |date=May 22, 2011 |accessdate=December 31, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512062023/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3170&p=.htm |archivedate=May 12, 2013 }} It dominated for three weekends at the overseas box office despite competition from ''[[The Hangover Part II]]'', ''[[Kung Fu Panda 2]]'', and ''[[X-Men: First Class]]''.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3176&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World Brief: 'Pirates' Booty Grows, 'Hangover,' 'Panda' Sequels Open Strongly |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |first=Gray |last=Brandon |date=May 31, 2011 |accessdate=June 1, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511161846/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3176&p=.htm |archivedate=May 11, 2013 }}{{cite news|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3180&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World Brief: 'Pirates' Out-Class 'X-Men' |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |first=Brandon |last=Gray |date=June 5, 2011 |accessdate=June 6, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512205004/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3180&p=.htm |archivedate=May 12, 2013 }} It reached the $300, $400 and $500-million-mark at the box office outside North America in record time (7, 11 and 14 days respectively), records first surpassed by ''Deathly Hallows – Part 2''.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3222&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World Roundup: 'Potter' Still Magic Overseas |publisher=Box Office Mojo |first=Subers |last=Ray |date=July 26, 2011 |accessdate=July 31, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511162929/http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3222&p=.htm |archivedate=May 11, 2013 }}{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/disneys-pirates-caribbean-hits-400-192291 |title=Disney's 'Pirates of the Caribbean' Hits $400 Million Worldwide in Less Than a Week |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=May 25, 2011 |accessdate=November 18, 2011 |first=Pamela |last=McClintock |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65zDQ01Wp?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/disneys-pirates-caribbean-hits-400-192291 |archivedate=March 7, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} ''On Stranger Tides'' set opening day records in both Russia (including the CIS) and Sweden. Subsequently, it set opening-weekend records in Latin America, the Middle East, Russia, Norway, Ukraine and Turkey, still retaining the record in Russia ($26.8 million){{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/cis/opening/ |title=RUSSIA – CIS ALL TIME OPENINGS |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=June 25, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130515145130/http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/cis/opening/ |archivedate=May 15, 2013 }} and Ukraine ($2.15 million).{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/ukraine/opening/ |title=UKRAINE ALL TIME OPENINGS |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=June 25, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130515152933/http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/ukraine/opening/ |archivedate=May 15, 2013 }} Its highest-grossing market after North America is Japan ($108.9 million), followed by China ($71.8 million){{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/christian-bale-flowers-of-war-dark-knight-china-box-office-277004 |title=Box Office Report: Christian Bale's 'Flowers of War' Already Top-Grossing Chinese Film of 2011 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=December 30, 2011 |accessdate=December 31, 2011 |first=Pamela |last=McClintock |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65zDWlehI?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/christian-bale-flowers-of-war-dark-knight-china-box-office-277004 |archivedate=March 7, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} and Russia and the CIS ($63.7 million).{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?page=intl&id=piratesofthecaribbean4.htm |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides (2011) – International Box Office Results |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130515033111/http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?page=intl&id=piratesofthecaribbean4.htm |archivedate=May 15, 2013 }} It is the highest-grossing film of 2011 in Russia and the CIS,{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/cis/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |title=Russia – CIS Yearly Box Office |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121023072020/http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/cis/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |archivedate=October 23, 2012 }} Austria,{{cite |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110807040235/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/intl/austria/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |archivedate=August 7, 2011 }} Ukraine,{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/ukraine/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |title=Ukraine Yearly Box Office |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121023072045/http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/ukraine/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |archivedate=October 23, 2012 }} Greece,{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/southafrica/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |title=South Africa (Entire Region) Yearly Box Office |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121023072222/http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/bulgaria/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |archivedate=October 23, 2012 }} Egypt,{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/egypt/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |title=Egypt Yearly Box Office |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121023072228/http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/egypt/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |archivedate=October 23, 2012 }} Estonia,{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/estonia/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |title=Estonia Yearly Box Office |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121023072248/http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/estonia/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |archivedate=October 23, 2012 }} and Latvia.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/latvia/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |title=Latvia Yearly Box Office |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121023072253/http://boxofficemojo.com/intl/latvia/yearly/?yr=2011&p=.htm |archivedate=October 23, 2012 }} ===Critical reception=== Review aggregation website [[Rotten Tomatoes]] gives the film an approval rating of 33% based on 259 reviews, with an average rating of 5/10. The site's critical consensus reads, "It's shorter and leaner than the previous sequel, but this ''Pirates'' runs aground on a disjointed plot and a non-stop barrage of noisy action sequences."{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/pirates_of_the_caribbean_on_stranger_tides |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides Reviews |work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] |publisher=[[Flixster]] |accessdate=July 6, 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170526154634/https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/pirates_of_the_caribbean_on_stranger_tides |archivedate=May 26, 2017 }} [[Metacritic]], which assigns a [[weighted average]] rating to reviews, gives the film an average score of 45 out of 100, based on 39 critics, indicating "mixed or average reviews".{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/pirates-of-the-caribbean-on-stranger-tides |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides |work=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=May 26, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121114155511/http://www.metacritic.com/movie/pirates-of-the-caribbean-on-stranger-tides |archivedate=November 14, 2012 }} [[CinemaScore]] polls reported that the average grade moviegoers gave the film was a "B+" on an A+ to F scale. [[Roger Ebert]] gave ''On Stranger Tides'' two out of four stars, saying that although the removal of Knightley and Bloom as well as the addition of Cruz were positive aspects, the film in general was "too much of a muchness" for him.{{cite news|url=http://rogerebert.suntimes.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20110518/REVIEWS/110519968 |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides |author=[[Roger Ebert|Ebert, Roger]] |work=[[Chicago Sun-Times]] |accessdate=July 9, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110712000828/http://rogerebert.suntimes.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=%2F20110518%2FREVIEWS%2F110519968 |archivedate=July 12, 2011 }} Tom Long of ''[[The Detroit News]]'' gave a D+, saying that Jack Sparrow had "worn out his welcome". Despite the more linear plot, "the movie is still ridiculous". He found ''On Stranger Tides'' to be "precisely what you'd expect of the fourth installment of a movie based on an amusement park ride: a whole lot of noise, plenty of stunts and complete silliness."{{cite web|url=http://detnews.com/article/20110519/ENT02/105190330/Review--Fourth-‘Pirates’-movie-makes-little-sense-but-a-lot-of-noise#ixzz1RbNWYxiX|title=Review: Fourth 'Pirates' movie makes little sense but a lot of noise|first=Tom|last=Long|work=[[The Detroit News]]|accessdate=July 9, 2011}} British film critic [[Mark Kermode]] gave the film an overwhelmingly negative review on his ''[[5 Live]]'' show, saying "it's not as staggeringly misjudged as the third part, because it is just nothing, it is just a big empty nothing, whereas part three I think was an active atrocity, it's just nothing at all".{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-13475908 |title=Mark Kermode savages new Pirates Of The Caribbean film |work=[[BBC]] |date=May 20, 2011 |accessdate=May 24, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110821022658/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-13475908 |archivedate=August 21, 2011 }} As with the previous films, the plot was criticized as incoherent and confusing. ''[[The Arizona Republic]]'' critic Bill Goodykoontz rated the film two out of five, stating that "the movie is a series of distractions tossed together in the hopes that they will come together in a coherent story. That never really happens."{{cite web|url=http://www.azcentral.com/thingstodo/movies/articles/2011/05/18/20110518review-pirates-caribbean-stranger-tides-goodykoontz.html|title='Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides,' 2 stars|first=Bill|last=Goodykoontz|work=[[The Arizona Republic]]|date=May 18, 2011|accessdate=July 9, 2011}} Online reviewer [[James Berardinelli]] considered the script "little more than a clothesline from which to dangle all of the obligatory set pieces",{{cite web|url=http://www.reelviews.net/php_review_template.php?identifier=2311 |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides |author=[[James Berardinelli|Berardinelli, James]] |date=May 19, 2011 |work=Reelviews |accessdate=August 1, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130403074520/http://www.reelviews.net/php_review_template.php?identifier=2311 |archivedate=April 3, 2013 }} and ''[[USA Today]]''{{'}}s Claudia Puig found ''On Stranger Tides'' "familiar and predictable...often incoherent and crammed with pointless details."{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/movies/reviews/2011-05-27-On-Stranger-Tides-movie-review_n.htm |title='Pirates: On Stranger Tides' in precarious position |first=Claudia |last=Puig |date=May 19, 2011 |work=[[USA Today]] |accessdate=August 1, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110808033813/http://www.usatoday.com/life/movies/reviews/2011-05-27-On-Stranger-Tides-movie-review_n.htm |archivedate=August 8, 2011 }} Mike Scott from ''[[The Times-Picayune]]'' mentions that "while this latest chapter isn't quite sharp enough to restore the sense of discovery that made that first outing so darn exciting, it's enough to make up for most of the missteps that made the third one so darn arrgh-inducing."{{cite web|url=http://www.nola.com/movies/index.ssf/2011/05/pirates_of_the_caribbean_on_st.html |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides |first=Mike |last=Scott |date=May 20, 2011 |work=The Times-Picayune |accessdate=August 1, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511213119/http://www.nola.com/movies/index.ssf/2011/05/pirates_of_the_caribbean_on_st.html |archivedate=May 11, 2013 }} Writing for ''[[The A.V. Club]]'', Tasha Robinson described ''On Stranger Tides'' as "a smaller film than past installments, by design and necessity", and felt that "the series has needed this streamlining" as the film "feels lightweight, but that's still better than bloated."{{cite web|url=http://www.avclub.com/articles/pirates-of-the-caribbean-on-stranger-tides,56276/ |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides |first=Tasha |last=Robinson |date=May 19, 2011 |work=[[The A.V. Club]] |accessdate=August 1, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120815122533/http://www.avclub.com/articles/pirates-of-the-caribbean-on-stranger-tides%2C56276/ |archivedate=August 15, 2012 }} ''On Stranger Tides'' also had positive reviews; some critics found the film to be entertaining and well-made. [[Richard Roeper]] gave the film a B+, describing it as "the most fun installment since the first", calling the story "pure cartoon, but a lot easier to follow than the other sequels", and summing as "the franchise is getting tired, but Penelope energizes it."{{cite web|url=http://www.richardroeper.com/reviews/piratesofthecaribbeanonstrangertides.aspx#share |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides |publisher=[[ReelzChannel]] |author=[[Richard Roeper|Roeper, Richard]] |accessdate=August 1, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130501170923/http://www.richardroeper.com/reviews/piratesofthecaribbeanonstrangertides.aspx |archivedate=May 1, 2013 }} Along the same lines, Ann Hornaday of ''[[The Washington Post]]'' gave the film three out of four stars, writing that it "feels as fresh and bracingly exhilarating as the day Jack Sparrow first swashed his buckle, infusing new reckless energy into a franchise that shows no signs of furling its sails". She said that Marshall "swiftly and without fuss delivers the action set pieces and eye-popping escapism" and praised Depp, Cruz, and McShane's performances.{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/review/VE1117945199?refcatid=31 |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides |first=Andrew |last=Barker |date=May 12, 2011 |work=Variety |accessdate=August 1, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110726234902/http://www.variety.com/review/VE1117945199?refcatid=31 |archivedate=July 26, 2011 }} Ray Bennett from ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' considered that Marshall "shows terrific flair with all the usual chases and sword fights, and he handles the 3D well", and welcomed Penélope Cruz's character, saying she "brings her Oscar-winning vivacity" and had "lively sexual tension" with Depp.{{cite news |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/pirates-caribbean-stranger-tides-review-186896 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/60nhWdjZN?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/pirates-caribbean-stranger-tides-review-186896 |archivedate=August 9, 2011 |title=Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides: Review |first=Ray |last=Bennett |date=May 10, 2011 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |accessdate=July 9, 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }} Writing for ''[[The Globe and Mail]]'', Rick Groen found the action scenes to range from "merely competent to tritely cluttered", but he was pleased with the overall result, calling McShane a "fresh villain" whose "stentorian tones are welcome anywhere".{{cite news|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/arts/movies/pirates-of-the-caribbean-4-ahoy-me-hearties-theres-treasure-amid-the-bloat/article2028649/ |title=Pirates of the Caribbean 4: Ahoy me hearties, there's treasure amid the bloat |first=Rick |last=Groen |date=May 20, 2011 |work=[[The Globe and Mail]] |accessdate=August 1, 2011 |location=Toronto |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110822144845/http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/arts/movies/pirates-of-the-caribbean-4-ahoy-me-hearties-theres-treasure-amid-the-bloat/article2028649/ |archivedate=August 22, 2011 }} ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'s'' Andrew Barker considered the film derivative, but accessible. "It has nary an original idea and still doesn't make much sense, but it's lost all pretensions that it should". He praised Geoffrey Rush, stating that he "not only gets the funniest lines and reaction shots, but also starts to siphon away much of the roguish charm that used to be Depp's stock and trade." ===Accolades=== {{See also|List of accolades received by the Pirates of the Caribbean franchise}} The film was nominated for four [[Teen Choice Awards]]: Sci-Fi/Fantasy Movie, Sci-Fi/Fantasy Actor, Sci-Fi/Fantasy Actress, and Villain.{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/b249838_teen_choice_awards_nominees_announced.html |title=Teen Choice Awards Nominees Announced |publisher=E! Online |date=June 29, 2011 |accessdate=June 29, 2011 |author=Garvey, Marianne |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110702203437/http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/b249838_teen_choice_awards_nominees_announced.html |archivedate=July 2, 2011 }} Its trailer and TV spot were nominated for [[Golden Trailer Awards]].{{cite web|url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/2011/6/prweb8526484.htm |title=The 12th Annual Golden Trailer Awards® Posts Nominations for Best Movie Promos of 2011: Live Gala Award Show Will be Held June 29 at the Music Box Theatre in L.A. |publisher=Golden Trailer Awards.com |date=June 3, 2011 |accessdate=June 18, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110607042507/http://www.prweb.com/releases/2011/6/prweb8526484.htm |archivedate=June 7, 2011 }} The film won Best Movie for Mature Audiences Award at the 2012 [[Movieguide Awards]].{{cite web|title=2012 Movieguide Awards Winners|url=https://movieguideawards.com/2012-movieguide-awards-winners/|website=Movieguide Awards|accessdate=29 June 2017|date=1 February 2012}} ==Sequel== {{further information|Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales}} On May 29, 2013, it was announced that ''[[Kon-Tiki (2012 film)|Kon-Tiki]]'' directors [[Joachim Rønning]] and [[Espen Sandberg]] would be directing ''Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales''.{{cite web|last=Fleming |first=Mike |url=http://www.deadline.com/2013/05/kon-tiki-helmer-joachim-ronning-and-espen-sandberg-land-pirates-of-the-caribbean-5/ |title='Kon-Tiki' Helmers Joachim Rønning and Espen Sandberg Land 'Pirates Of The Caribbean 5' |publisher=Deadline.com |date= |accessdate=July 6, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130901025036/http://www.deadline.com/2013/05/kon-tiki-helmer-joachim-ronning-and-espen-sandberg-land-pirates-of-the-caribbean-5/ |archivedate=September 1, 2013 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=108110 |title=Pirates of the Caribbean 5 Title Revealed! |publisher= |accessdate=October 4, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140730135841/http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=108110 |archivedate=July 30, 2014 }} While earlier reports stated ''Dead Men Tell No Tales'' would be released between 2015 and 2016,{{cite news|last=Masters |first=Kim |title='Pirates of the Caribbean 5' Delayed Beyond Summer 2015 |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/pirates-caribbean-5-delayed-beyond-625570 |accessdate=September 10, 2013 |newspaper=the Hollywood Reporter |date=September 10, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160219002048/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/pirates-caribbean-5-delayed-beyond-625570 |archivedate=February 19, 2016 }} Disney announced in 2014 that the film would enter theaters on July 2017.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.disney.com/insider/2014/07/23/raise-a-black-flag-a-new-pirates-of-the-caribbean-film-is-coming/?cmp=SMC |title=Raise a Black Flag! 2014 }} Production began in late February 2015 in Australia.{{cite web|url=http://www.movieweb.com/pirates-caribbean-5-starts-production |title='Pirates 5' Starts Shooting in 2 Weeks; First Set Photo {{Multiple issues| {{unreferenced|date=February 2009}} {{notability|date=February 2009}} {{essay|date=February 2009}} }}
'''Radio Twist''' is the first and only nationally syndicated gay-friendly radio show on the FM dial. Debuting in January 2006, Twist was billed as a show specifically aimed at the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender ([[LGBT]]) audience and promised to be "radio with a twist." Airing on 16 Pop and Adult Contemporary radio stations nationwide, the hosts also make it a point to include the "straight" listener every week.
==Hosts== Twist has a novel hosting arrangement - four hosts in four cities. However, despite coming from four cities, the show broadcasts from a powerful transmitter in [[Daly City, California]]. The show's production also takes place there.
New York - [[Ben Harvey (American radio personality)|Ben Harvey]]. Harvey is best known for being the evening jock on 92.3 K-Rock [[WNYL (FM)|WXRK]] in New York City. He has also worked for Y100 [[Y-Rock On XPN|WPLY]] in Philadelphia and was a TV correspondent for [[Here! TV]], the gay and lesbian cable network.
Atlanta - [[Melissa Carter]]. Carter is an "out" lesbian on Q100 [[WWWQ]]'s morning show. She hails from Atlanta, adding an interesting sound to the show.
Los Angeles - [[Dennis Hensley]]. Dennis has written several books and writes for many magazines, including [[Entertainment Weekly]] and [[GQ]]. He's been described as a "Hollywood Insider" and was even featured as one of [[Kathy Griffin]]'s "main gays" in season one of her Bravo series.
==Show programming== '''Famous Friend''' - Celebrities, both gay and "gay-friendly," stop by the studios and chat with the hosts. So far Twist has had Famous Friends including [[Beyoncé]], [[Anthony Kiedis]], [[Hilary Duff]], [[Peyton Manning]], [[Sarah Jessica Parker]], [[Harry Connick, Jr.]], [[Pink (singer)|Pink]], [[John Waters (filmmaker)|John Waters]], [[Janet Jackson]], and [[Eric McCormack]].
'''Twist LDDs''' - If [[Casey Kasem]] were gay, this is what Long Distance Dedications would sound like! It's a gay spin on a classic radio staple.
'''Big Gay 7''' - Every week Ben, Melissa, and Dennis count down the "Big Gay 5," what the show calls the "biggest hits in 'Gayville, USA'" as decided by the Twist listeners.
'''You're Talking about it So We're Talking about it''' - Melissa runs down the headlines in gay & lesbian news, while Ben and Dennis pipe in with sometimes snarky and sometimes thoughtful comments.
'''Too Much Information''' - Dennis serves up the latest celebrity dish every week in his gossiplicious installment of TMI.
==Cancellation==
Radio with a Twist was canceled on Wednesday November 26, 2008 or as many affiliates are saying, put on an indefinite Hiatus due to economic reasons. The reason cited was that local affiliates could no longer afford to air it weeknights from Midnight - 2am. It was replaced on an interim basis by most stations extending their overnight DJ's shift by 2 hours. Beginning Tuesday February 17, 2009 [[The Billy Bush Show!]] will replace it permanently at an earlier time with an extra hour from 9pm - Midnight, thus shortening the PM DJ shift to 2 hours in order to cut costs, and keeping the over night DJ's shift extended to 6 hours permanently. It aired in the top sixteen markets across the United States. Its flagship station [[WPLJ]] in New York was the first to pull out.
There is a web petition as well as information sign up sheet on Radio with a Twist's home page and even a [[Facebook]] group with the hopes that at some point in 2009 it will relaunch. No word as to how, when, or where and even what format the relaunch will happen. With the premier of The Billy Bush Show! however it is not likely that Radio with a Twist will be back any time soon. To sign up for more information visit the website listed below.
== Where to tune in == The 16 stations are listed on Twist's official web site, [http://www.radiotwist.net].

{{Unreferenced|date=January 2007}} {{Infobox video game |title = Rayman Raving Rabbids |image = Rayman Raving Rabbids (handheld game).jpg |developer = [[Visual Impact Productions]] (GBA)
[[Ubisoft Sofia]] |publisher = [[Ubisoft]] |designer = |engine = |series = ''[[Rayman|Rayman series]], [[Raving Rabbids|Rabbid]]s series'' |released ='''[[Game Boy Advance]]'''{{vgrelease|NA|November 14, 2006|AUS|December 7, 2006|EU|December 8, 2006}} '''[[Nintendo DS]]'''{{vgrelease|NA|March 6, 2007|AUS|March 15, 2007|EU|March 16, 2007}} |genre = [[Platform game|Platform]]
[[Party game#Party video games|Party]] |modes = [[Single-player]] |platforms = [[Game Boy Advance]], [[Nintendo DS]] }} '''''[[Rayman Raving Rabbids]]''''' is a [[platform game|platform]] [[video game]] published and developed by [[Ubisoft]] for the [[Game Boy Advance]] and [[Nintendo DS]] [[handheld game console|handheld]] [[video game console]]s. It was also released on the [[Wii]], [[PlayStation 2]], and [[Xbox 360]] video game consoles, as well as the [[Microsoft Windows|PC]]. Unlike these versions which focus on mini-games, the handheld versions are more similar to traditional Rayman platformers. ==Characters== {{main|Rayman (character)}} Rayman: Rayman is the main character in this game and Ubisoft's mascot. He has been captured by the insane bunnies and must take part in all the Rabbids' challenges so they are entertained. Eventually he collects 100 trophies and gets to fight the Rabbids' ultimate commander: the Rabble Droid! Note that in this game, his in-game model is the same one that was used in Rayman 2: The Great Escape/Rayman DS. Rabbids: The Rabbids are the antagonists of the game and have captured Rayman. They have put him in a gladiator-styled arena where he must take part in all their challenges in order to face up to the Rabble Droid. They are completely insane and would do ''literally'' anything to stop Rayman. ==Game Boy Advance== '''''[[Rayman Raving Rabbids]]''''' for the [[Game Boy Advance]] is a [[platform game|platforming]] [[video game]], unlike the console versions which are trial-based. It features characters and elements from previous Rayman games which are not present in the console versions of Raving Rabbids. ===Plot=== The game begins with Rayman taking a nap, only to be captured by insane bunnies who lock him up in a cell. When Rayman comes to his senses, he notices his hands are missing. With Murfy's help, he retrieves his hands and escapes the prison. Soon, Rayman's fairy friend Ly appears and tells him about the bunnies. According to her, they used to live happily and acted innocently. Their kind nature led other creatures to make fun of them and always give them a hard time. The bunnies then fled underground, and have only now resurfaced to have their revenge against everyone. Rayman is the world's only hope to stop them. ===Gameplay=== The gameplay is similar to the original [[Rayman (video game)|Rayman side-scrolling game]], however Rayman loses his 'adventurous' music. The game also uses the concept of the cancelled Rayman 4 prototype. ==Nintendo DS== '''''[[Rayman Raving Rabbids]]''''' is a platform and party [[video game]] for the [[Nintendo DS]]. It was released on March 6, 2007. The game is not only a platform like the Game Boy Advance version but also a party game like the console versions. ===Plot=== While taking a quiet walk in the forest one day, Rayman is captured by The Rabbids. They have decided to invade our world, and now Rayman is their toy, a prisoner [[gladiator]] to entertain them. Rayman's only chance at freedom is to face the Rabbid Droid, but to do that, he must win enough trophies and fight other champions. The version's plot is based on the console versions. ===Gameplay=== This game has five worlds: Beach, Forest, Jungle, Factory and Ice. The Beach world is more of a tutorial, and the Ice world only has two levels, each one a boss level. Nearly all the levels are set out like this: Get through the platforming part, beat the minigame and finally the ultimate challenge test. The platforming parts are like most other Rayman games, where you have to follow the path, beating enemies and collecting items. The final challenge of each level is usually a game where Rayman is running forward of his own accord. Using your costumes of Earth, Fire, Ice and Wind, you must interact with obstacles to help Rayman get through alive and escape from the bunnies spaceship that is chasing him. On your way, you must collect all the trophies of that level in one go. There are 100 trophies in the entire game. Also, there are three Ray Gear challenges in which you must avoid enemies fire and destroy the giant. Fish Creature. These are timed, as if you are on the challenge for too long, a counter will start counting down to how long you have left. {{Raving Rabbids series}} {{Rayman}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rayman Raving Rabbids (Handheld Game)}} [[Category:2006 video games]] [[Category:Game Boy Advance games]] [[Category:Nintendo DS games]] [[Category:Party video games]] [[Category:Rayman]] [[Category:Raving Rabbids]] [[Category:Ubisoft games]] [[Category:Video games developed in Bulgaria]] [[Category:Video games developed in France]]

[[NHK BS2]] ([[Japan]]) | picture_format = | audio_format = [[Stereo]] | first_aired = January 21, 1999 | last_aired = July 23, 1999 }} '''''RESTOL Special Rescue Squad''''' (레스톨 특수구조대) is a 1999 [[South Korea]]n [[Animated series#Television|animated television series]] created by Seoul Movie. == Plot == In 2034, the future world experienced serious natural disasters. In 2035, GEONOID was established as a company in order to protect the earth against natural calamities. Furthermore, the organization set up SRS (Special Rescue Services) that consists of the orbiting rescue station R-SAT, five RESTOL units, and the Shell Diver carrier ship. Kang Maru, a 14-year-old boy, was chosen by GEONOID via a simulation video game competition to pilot RESTOL unit 03, as he demonstrated superb skills. == Releases == {|border="1" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" |- ! scope="col" | Country ! scope="col" | Release Date ! scope="col" | Title |- | South Korea | January 29, 1999 | 레스톨 특수구조대 ([[Korean Broadcasting System|KBS]]) |- | Japan | October 5, 1999 | 装甲救助部隊レストル ([[NHK|NHK BS2]]) |- | Hong Kong | October 17, 2000 | Telecast Station ([[Television Broadcasts Limited|TVB]]) |- | Philippines | | Restol ([[DWET-TV|ABC-5]]) |- | Serbia | | Restol ([[Kanal D]]) |} == Castings == The following castings are based on Korean version. * Kang Maru (강마루)—Choi Won-Hyeong * Oming (오밍)—Kim Hye-Mi * Mia (미아)—Kim Soo-Gyeong * Punky (펑키)—Seong Byeong-Sook * Heron (헤론)—Choi Byeong-Sang * Lucifer (루시퍼)—Choi Byeong-Sang * Victor (빅터)—Choi Byeong-Sang * Reth (레스사령관)—Choi Moon-Ja * Kou (코우선장)—Jang Gwang * Kain (카인)—Kang Goo-Han * Jin (진)—Kim Il * Hanse (한스)—Lee Jeong-Goo * Jei (제이)—Lim Eun-Jeong == External links == * {{Ann anime|anime|id=2346}} [[Category:South Korean animation]] [[Category:South Korean films]] {{SouthKorea-film-stub}} {{Animation-film-stub}}

revision.text:
{{More citations needed|date=January 2011}} {{Infobox video game |title = The 11th Hour |image = The 11th Hour Coverart.png |developer = [[Trilobyte (company)|Trilobyte]] |publisher = [[Virgin Interactive Entertainment]] |producer = James Yokota |designer = [[Rob Landeros]]
[[Graeme Devine]] |programmer = Graeme Devine |artist = Robert Stein III
Rob Landeros |writer= [[Matthew Costello]]
David Wheeler |composer= [[George Sanger (musician)|George Sanger]] |series = |engine = |platforms = [[DOS]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Mac OS]] |released = '''DOS/Windows'''
{{Video game release|NA|November 30, 1995|EU|1995}}'''Mac OS'''
{{Video game release|NA|January 1, 1996}} |genre = [[Interactive movie]], [[Puzzle adventure game|puzzle adventure]] |modes = [[Single-player]] }} '''''The 11th Hour''''' is a 1995 [[interactive movie]] [[puzzle adventure game]] with a [[horror fiction|horror]] setting. It is the sequel to the 1993 game ''[[The 7th Guest]]''. ==Plot== The story opens 60 years after the events of ''The 7th Guest''. It is now 1995, and the player assumes the role of Carl Denning, an [[investigative reporter]] for the television series "Case Unsolved". Robin Morales, his producer and lover, mysteriously vanished three weeks prior in Harley-on-the-Hudson, [[New York (state)|New York]]. She was investigating a series of grisly murders and disappearances that had plagued the otherwise sleepy upstate town over the last few months. Denning's only solid lead is a [[portable computer]] called the GameBook delivered with only a postmark from Harley. When booted, the GameBook displays Robin's plea to help her escape. The story then flashes back to the beginning of Robin's investigation. She interviews Eileen Wiley, the only person known to have survived an encounter with Henry Stauf's mansion. Eileen confirms she lost her hand that night, claiming it had been bitten off by a dog, but offers no other meaningful details of the encounter. Suspicious of Eileen's story, Robin interviews Dr. Thornton, who treated Eileen that night. Though the doctor appears to believe Eileen about the dog, the interview proves fruitful as Dr. Thornton reveals that Eileen was not alone that night; her friend Samantha Ford was with her in the house those 18 years ago. Samantha's family used its considerable influence to keep her involvement out of the papers. He also reveals that Samantha has been [[paralyzed]] from the waist down ever since the girls' encounter. Robin attempts to interview Samantha, but their meeting is adversarial. Samantha's forceful denials convince Robin that the women are not telling the truth about their encounter. Samantha confirms Robin's suspicions later that evening when she visit's Robin's motel room and shares her story. Samantha claims that during their encounter with the house, something supernatural held the girls down and raped them, then let them go. Samantha had an illegal [[abortion]] that resulted in her paralysis, but Eileen had a daughter, Marie. Samantha claims there was always something sinister about the child and believes that all hell let loose around Marie's 18th birthday, that Marie is the mansion's offspring, and that Marie is responsible for the murders and disappearances. Robin confronts Eileen with the story, and Eileen denies everything. Eileen then challenges Robin to go to the house herself. After Robin leaves, it's revealed that Marie was listening to the entire conversation. Desperate to keep her secret from getting out, Marie commands her lover Chuck to murder Robin. He initially resists, worried about the media attention a famous disappearance would bring, and Marie challenges him to say "no" to Stauf. He enters Robin's hotel and stabs someone sleeping in bed, but it's revealed that he actually stabbed the police chief who had a budding romance with Robin. Unable to remove the knife, he takes the body to Stauf's mansion, where he is pulled inside and killed for his mistake. Robin comes to the house soon after and fatefully enters as Samantha watches remotely, somehow having hacked into Stauf's surveillance. As Robin moves through the house, it breaks her by systematically confronting her with uncomfortable truths about her past. He eventually wins her over by enticing her with her own [[television network]]. The story then picks up with Carl in the mansion. He follows Robin's cries upstairs where he meets Stauf, who is presiding over a [[game show]] called "Let’s Make a Real Deal" (a parody of [[Let's Make a Deal]]). Stauf explains that Carl must choose to open one of the doors, then offers Carl $600. Carl can keep it, or he can pay $200 and reveal what's behind one of the three doors in front of him. He pays to reveal door number two, which turns out to be a large TV. Next, he pays door number one, which is Marie. As Stauf tempts Carl with Marie's sexual prowess, Samantha hacks into the TV, warning him not to give in to temptation as Stauf mocks her paralysis. Finally, Carl pays to reveal door number three, which is Robin. She expresses her love for Carl, pleading with him to choose her. Samantha urges Carl to choose her, revealing that this will end Stauf forever and that choosing either of the others will doom him. The game turns Carl's choice over to the player, which reveals one of three endings: * '''Carl chooses Samantha:''' reaching out his hand to touch Samantha’s on the TV. A moment later, he walks through Samantha’s front door, and they watch the house burn to the ground on her monitors. Carl expresses regret about Robin, but Samantha laments that Robin was lost the moment she said "yes" to Stauf. * '''Carl chooses Robin:''' Carl and Robin embrace as Samantha looks on in disappointment. The story then flashes forward weeks later, where Robin is in Carl's living room watching the news of his body being found in the [[Hudson River]]. The newscaster reports that he disappeared on his honeymoon in Harley-on-the-Hudson after marrying Robin, who is the new president of the Stauf Broadcasting System. * '''Carl chooses Marie:''' as Samantha and Robin look on, Carl gives in to Marie's temptations. Marie leads him through a door to another room, and as the two have sex, Marie morphs into Stauf. The Stauf/Marie hybrid then taunts Carl while eating cooked ribs, which they claim to be his. ==Gameplay== Overall, the gameplay is similar to its predecessor's with the same [[Puzzle video game|puzzle]]-based gameplay structure, but with the additional element of a [[treasure hunt]].{{cite journal|last= |first= |title=Next Wave: The 11th Hour |journal=[[Electronic Gaming Monthly]]|issue=78|publisher=[[Ziff Davis]]|date=January 1996|pages=144–6}} ==Release== Although Trilobyte stated in 1993—even before ''The 7th Guest''{{'}}s became available—that it planned to release ''The 11th Hour'' by October of that year,{{cite news|url=http://www.cgwmuseum.org/galleries/index.php?year=1993&pub=2&id=105 |title=The Rumor Bag |work=Computer Gaming World |date=April 1993 |accessdate=6 July 2014 |pages=88 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140702235842/http://www.cgwmuseum.org/galleries/index.php?year=1993&pub=2&id=105 |archivedate=2 July 2014 }} it was very late to market and failed to meet sales expectations upon its release.{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/features/btg-tri/part3-5.html |title=Haunted Glory: The Rise and Fall of Trilobyte |last=Keighley |first=Geoff |publisher=[[GameSpot]] |date=22 September 1999 |accessdate=28 December 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081212102634/http://www.gamespot.com/features/btg-tri/part3-5.html |archivedate=12 December 2008 }} Early into its development, a port to the [[3DO Interactive Multiplayer|3DO]] was planned, and a release date of May 1994 was announced,{{cite journal|last= |first= |title=Shipping in May|journal=[[GamePro]]|issue=58|publisher=[[International Data Group|IDG]]|date=May 1994|page=160}} but it was pushed back to March 1995,{{cite journal|last= |first= |title=The 11th Hour: The Sequel to the 7th Guest|journal=[[GamePro]]|issue=68 |publisher=[[International Data Group|IDG]]|date=March 1995|page=145}} and ultimately cancelled. Trilobyte had confirmed that the game would be released on both the [[iPhone]] and [[iPad]] platforms. The release for iOS was scheduled for Q2/Q3 2011, but in March 2012 Trilobyte postponed the release indefinitely due to "serious technical challenges".{{cite web |url=http://www.trilobytegames.com/11thHour.html |title=The 11th Hour |date=27 March 2012 |accessdate=15 August 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120327232711/http://www.trilobytegames.com/11thHour.html |archivedate=27 March 2012}} In April 2012, ''The 7th Guest: Book of Secrets'' application for iOS was renamed to just ''Book of Secrets'', and was updated to include a walkthrough and script for ''The 11th Hour'', just as it already had for ''7th Guest''. In 2012, ''The 11th Hour'' was re-released for Windows, as a download from [[DotEmu]] and [[GOG.com]].{{cite web |url=http://www.dotemu.com/en/download-game/2788/the-7th-guest |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-11-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121025085206/http://www.dotemu.com/en/download-game/2788/the-7th-guest |archivedate=2012-10-25 |df= }}{{cite web |url=http://www.dotemu.com/en/download-game/2790/the-11th-hour |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-11-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121107015316/http://www.dotemu.com/en/download-game/2790/the-11th-hour |archivedate=2012-11-07 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.gog.com/en/news/trilobyte_games_joins_list_of_gog_com_partners |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-11-01 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120430071617/http://www.gog.com/en/news/trilobyte_games_joins_list_of_gog_com_partners |archivedate=2012-04-30 }} On October 18, 2013, it was re-released again on [[Steam (software)|Steam]], as part of a collaboration between Trilobyte and [[Night Dive Studios]].{{cite web|url=http://www.gameranx.com/updates/id/18210/article/trilobyte-games-add-classics-the-7th-guest-and-the-11th-hour-to-steam/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-09-23 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150925095235/http://www.gameranx.com/updates/id/18210/article/trilobyte-games-add-classics-the-7th-guest-and-the-11th-hour-to-steam/ |archivedate=2015-09-25 }} ==Development== The makers of the game originally intended for it to contain more adult content in its [[cut scenes]]; the script for the game (published as part of a [[walk-through]] guide) included several [[Motion Picture Association of America film rating system#MPAA film ratings|R-rated]] sex scenes. Rumors immediately surfaced that an "uncut" version of ''11th Hour'' existed, leading to the game makers announcing that the R-rated sequences, though planned, were never filmed. Many of the videos that were filmed for the game used [[Location shooting|location shooting]]; the fifth scene utilised a [[Chroma key|blue screen]] incorporating a neutral blue drape. Macintosh Premier was used to convert the capture film into digitized images and videos. A program called 'Wavelet' was used to compress the game's videos.{{cite journal |last= |first= |date=August 1994 |title=CD-ROM Today 04 |journal= |location= |author= |publisher=[[Future Publishing]] |issue=4 |page=77 }} It was developed by [[Trilobyte (company)|Trilobyte]] and used a later version of the Groovie [[game engine|graphic engine]] than that used by ''The 7th Guest''.{{cite book |date=1995 |title=Game Manual|page=35|quote=The 11th Hour: Sequel to the 7th Guest was created using the Groovie authoring system from Trilobyte Inc.}} ''The 11th Hour'' also features the music of [[George Sanger (musician)|George "The Fat Man" Sanger]] and Team Fat. ==Reception== {{Expand section|date=January 2011}} {{Video game reviews | PCGUS = 76%{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/19991201045720/http://www.pcgamer.com/reviews/1294.html | url=http://www.pcgamer.com:80/reviews/1294.html | title=''11th Hour, The'' | date=May 1996 | author=Wolf, Scott | archivedate=December 1, 1999 | deadurl=yes | work=[[PC Gamer US]] | df= }} |CGW = {{rating|3|5}} |rev1 = ''Maximum'' |rev1Score = {{rating|3|5}} |rev2 = ''[[Next Generation (magazine)|Next Generation]]'' |rev2Score = {{rating|2|5}} | rev3 = ''[[PC Magazine]]'' | rev3Score = {{Rating|3|4}}{{cite journal | author=Mooney, Shane | journal=[[PC Magazine]] | title=The Many Paths Toward Adventure; ''The 11th Hour'' | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20001215045100/http://www.zdnet.com/pcmag/issues/1505/pcm00091.htm | url=http://www.zdnet.com/pcmag/issues/1505/pcm00091.htm | archivedate=December 15, 2000 | date=March 12, 1996 | deadurl=yes | df= }} | rev4 = ''[[Computer Games Magazine|Computer Games Strategy Plus]]'' | rev4Score = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/19971007225055/http://www.cdmag.com/traditional_vault/11th_hour/page1.html | url=http://www.cdmag.com:80/traditional_vault/11th_hour/page1.html | title=''The 11th Hour'' | date=March 5, 1996 | work=[[Computer Games Magazine|Computer Games Strategy Plus]] | archivedate=October 7, 1997 | deadurl=yes | df= }} | rev5 = ''PC Games'' | rev5Score = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite magazine | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/19961018113242/http://www.pcgamesmag.com/games/Feb96/11hour296.html | url=http://www.pcgamesmag.com:80/games/Feb96/11hour296.html | title=''The 11th Hour'' | magazine=PC Games | author=Lasky, Michael | date=February 1996 | archivedate=October 18, 1996 | deadurl=yes | df= }} }} Reviews of the game upon initial release were mixed. After extensively praising the game's graphics, challenging puzzles, storyline, and atmosphere, as well as the lower amount of gratuitous gore when compared to ''The 7th Guest'', a reviewer for ''Maximum'' concluded "However, the bottom line is that ''11th Hour'' is basically a more advanced version of ''7th Guest''."{{cite magazine|last= |first= |title=Maximum Reviews: 11th Hour|magazine=Maximum: The Video Game Magazine|issue=3 |publisher=[[Emap International Limited]]|date=January 1996|page=159}} A reviewer for ''[[Next Generation (magazine)|Next Generation]]'' also found the game much too similar to its predecessor, particularly as he considered the entire genre of puzzle adventures to be a waste of time. He also criticized that the game has long load times except when running on high-end computers.{{cite magazine|last=|first= |title=About Time |magazine=[[Next Generation (magazine)|Next Generation]]|issue=16|publisher=[[Imagine Media]]|date=April 1996|page=92}} [[Arinn Dembo]] reviewed the game for [[Computer Gaming World]].Dembo, Arinn; ''This Old House: The Sequel to 7th Guest Strikes Perilously Close to Midnight'', p. 128. Computer Gaming World, Issue 140, March 1996 In 2010, [[UGO]] included the game in the article The 11 Weirdest Game Endings.{{Cite web|url=http://www.ugo.com/games/the-11-weirdest-game-endings?page=2 |title=The 11 Weirdest Game Endings |author=K. Thor Jensen |publisher=UGO.com |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101208041224/http://www.ugo.com/games/the-11-weirdest-game-endings?page=2 |archivedate=2010-12-08 }} By April 1995, Trilobyte planned to launch ''The 11th Hour'' with a shipment of 250,000 copies.{{cite journal | author=Sengstack, Jeff | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/19970713194008/http://www.newmedia.com/NewMedia/95/7/screens/11thHour.html | url=http://www.newmedia.com:80/NewMedia/95/7/screens/11thHour.html | title=The 11th Hour of ''The 11th Hour'' | date=July 1995 | archivedate=July 13, 1997 | journal=NewMedia | deadurl=yes | df= }} However, by December, retailers in the United States had ordered 500,000 units of the game.{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/19970419221549/http://www.next-generation.com/news/120195b.html | url=http://www.next-generation.com:80/news/120195b.html | title=''11th Hour'' to Hit Super Consoles | date=December 1, 1995 | archivedate=April 19, 1997 | author=Staff | work=[[Next Generation (magazine)|Next Generation]] | deadurl=yes | df= }} According to [[Geoff Keighley]], "''The 11th Hour'' had the biggest ship-out of a PC game up until that point - nearly half a million units".https://web.archive.org/web/20010610152938/http://www.gamespot.com/features/btg-tri/part3-4.html The game was a commercial success, with sales of nearly 300,000 copies in the United States alone by May 1996.{{cite web |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/19970205015601/http://www.gamespot.com/features/vaporware/ |url=http://www.gamespot.com/features/vaporware/ |title=Vaporware Hall of Shame |author=Poole, Stephen |date=1996 |archivedate=February 5, 1997 |work=[[GameSpot]] |deadurl=yes |df= }} ===Awards=== ''The 11th Hour'' won the following awards: *1995 New Media Invision Awards - Gold-Games Strategy/Puzzle{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} *1995 New Media Invision Awards - Bronze-Consumer Interactive Movies{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} *1995 International Cindy Competition - Honorable Mention - Consumer Games{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} *1995 CD-ROM Today "Rommie" Awards - Best Graphic Adventure{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{moby game|id=/11th-hour|name=The 11th Hour}} *{{IMDb title|0164310}} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20000831191958/http://gamespot.com/features/btg-tri/index.html The rise and fall of Trilobyte] - Detailed article on the company, including the making of ''The 11th Hour''. {{Trilobyte}} {{DEFAULTSORT:11th Hour, The}} [[Category:1995 video games]] [[Category:Adventure games]] [[Category:DOS games]] [[Category:First-person adventure games]] [[Category:Full motion video based games]] [[Category:Interactive movie video games]] [[Category:Mac OS games]] [[Category:MacOS games]] [[Category:Psychological horror games]] [[Category:Puzzle video games]] [[Category:Single-player video games]] [[Category:Video game sequels]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United States]] [[Category:Video games scored by George Sanger]] [[Category:Video games set in the 1990s]] [[Category:Video games set in the United States]] [[Category:Virgin Interactive games]] [[Category:Windows games]]

{{Multiple issues| {{notability|Companies|date=November 2015}} {{refimprove|date=November 2015}} {{advert|date=October 2015}} }}
'''The Cow Company''' is a production company based in Chile, created in 2007 by Marcos Alvo and Ronny Majlis.
Since 2013 the company has produced over 10 theater plays with great success by both the audience and the critics, being called by the media as "the company behind the biggest theatrical successes in Chile".<ref>{{Cite web|title = El Mercurio Revista WIKEN|url = http://impresa.elmercurio.com/Pages/NewsDetail.aspx?dt=2015-08-14&dtB=06-10-2015%25200:00:00&PaginaId=6&SupplementId=3&bodyid=0|website = impresa.elmercurio.com|accessdate = 2015-10-07}}</ref>
Among the plays produced by The Cow Company are:
* "Un Dios Salvaje" (''[[God of Carnage]]'') by [[Yasmina Reza]], directed by Andrés Céspedes. * "Rojo" ([[Red (play)|''Red'']]) by [[John Logan (writer)|John Logan]], directed by Rodrigo Sepúlveda. * "Cock" (''Cock'') by [[Mike Bartlett (playwright)|Mike Bartlett]], directed by Alvaro Viguera. * "Venus en Piel" (''[[Venus in Fur]]'') by [[David Ives]], directed by Andrés Céspedes. * "Le Prenom" (''Le Prenom'') by [[Alexandre De La Patellière]] y Matthieu Delaporte, directed by Pato Pimienta. * "El Crédito" (''El Crèdit'') by [[Jordi Galceran]], directed by [[Javiera Contador]]. * "Los Pájaros Cantan en Griego" by Marco Antonio de la Parra, directed by Aliocha de la Sotta. * "Sunset Limited" (''[[The Sunset Limited]]'') by [[Cormac McCarthy]], directed by Alvaro Viguera (being called by the press as the play you can`t miss<ref>{{Cite web|title = El Mercurio.com|url = http://diario.elmercurio.com/detalle/index.asp?id=%7B4fea298c-f429-4b84-a1db-424014596f7b%7D|website = diario.elmercurio.com|accessdate = 2015-10-07}}</ref>) * "[[Closer (play)|Closer]]" by [[Patrick Marber]], directed by Cristián Campos.
==References== {{reflist}} <!-- After listing your sources please cite them using inline citations and place them after the information they cite. Please see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:REFB for instructions on how to add citations. --> *Revista Wiken de El Mercurio, 14 de agosto 2015 * * *

{{DEFAULTSORT:Cow Company}} [[Category:Theatre production companies]]

{{Infobox book | name = The Manual... | image = TheManual.jpg | caption = | author = [[The Timelords]] ([[Bill Drummond]] and [[Jimmy Cauty]]) | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = United Kingdom | language = | subject = | genre = | publisher = [[KLF Publications]] | release_date = [[1988 in literature|1988]] | media_type = | pages = | isbn = 0-86359-616-9 | oclc= 20097625 }}
'''''The Manual (How to Have a Number One the Easy Way)''''' is a 1988 book by "The Timelords" ([[Bill Drummond]] and [[Jimmy Cauty]]), better known as [[The KLF]]. It is a step by step guide to achieving a No.1 single with no money or musical skills, and a case study of the duo's UK [[Novelty song|novelty pop]] No. 1 "[[Doctorin' the Tardis]]".
==How to have a number one== The advice dispensed by The Manual includes: "Firstly, you must be [[wiktionary:skint|skint]] and on [[Jobseeker's Allowance|the dole]]. Anybody with a proper job or tied up with full time education will not have the time to devote to see it through... Being on the dole gives you a clearer perspective on how much of society is run... having no money sharpens the wits. Forces you never to make the wrong decision. There is no safety net to catch you when you fall." and "If you are already a musician stop playing your instrument. Even better, sell the junk." The book also foretells its own imminent irrelevance, The Timelords admitting that they are writing "a book that will be completely redundant within twelve months. An obsolete <!-- see MOS:PMC concerning dialectical "artifact" spelling --> artefact. Its only use being a bit of a social history that records the aspirations of a certain strata {{sic}} in British society in the late eighties..."
The book is prophetic when it comes to recording technology: "It's obvious that in a very short space of time the Japanese will have delivered the technology and then brought the price of it down so that you can do the whole thing at home. Then you will be able to sod off all that crap about going into studios."<!-- is this too long? -->
Bill Drummond explained his motivations in an interview: "It was an excuse to say a lot of things I wanted to say about how the industry worked. It was an excuse to go out and say to people all they can say to themselves: If you want to do something, go and do it! Don't wait to be asked, don't wait for a record company to come and want to sign you or a management company. Just go and do it. Also, it was saying: If you wanna have number one...you can have it. It won't make you rich, it won't make you happy, but you can have it."<ref name="Bomlagadafshipoing">Transcript of a Bill Drummond interview on "Bomlagadafshipoing" (Norwegian national radio house-music show), September 1991 ([http://www.libraryofmu.net/display-resource.php?id=521 link]).</ref>
==Influence and reach== The English-language version of ''The Manual'' has had at least 3 print runs (see ISBNs below), being reissued in 1989 and—with a new foreword by Drummond—in 1998. The book has also been translated into German, and was released as an [[audiobook]] (read by Bela B., drummer of the punk band [[Die Ärzte]]) in Germany in 2003,<ref>''The KLF, Das Handbuch, Der schnelle Weg zum Nr. 1 Hit'', 2 audio CDs read by Bela B. Universal Music, 2003. {{ISBN|3-8291-1352-8}}.</ref> with Drummond voicing the foreword, a motivational piece about reaching out for one's dreams ''today''—"tomorrow is always too late". In 2010, the book was published in [[Czech language|Czech]].<ref>'' KLF – Manual (Jak se dostat na vrchol hitparady)'', published in 2010 by J. Brezina and Jakub Jandourek, Czech republic. {{ISBN|978-80-254-6529-5}}.</ref>
The Austrian Eurotrash band [[Edelweiss (band)|Edelweiss]] took the book as a primary influence: they read the book, borrowed [[ABBA]]'s "[[SOS (ABBA song)|SOS]]", and sold five million copies worldwide with "Bring Me Edelweiss".<ref>Longmire, E. "KLF Is Going to Rock You" ''X Magazine'', July 1991 ([http://cardhouse.com/x07/klf.html link])</ref><ref>Reighley, K.B. "Hear No Evil", ''[[Seattle Weekly]]'', 26 May 1999 ([http://www.seattleweekly.com/music/9921/two-reighley.php link] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303211002/http://www.seattleweekly.com/music/9921/two-reighley.php |date=2016-03-03 }})</ref> It also proved to be an influence on 2000s British girl group [[The Pipettes]] who formed after reading the book in order to explore "the idea of being a pop machine."<ref>Barton, Laura. "Leaders of the pack", ''[[The Guardian]]'', 1 November 2006 ([http://music.guardian.co.uk/pop/story/0,,1936461,00.html link])</ref>
In the liner photographs of the [[Chumbawamba]] album ''[[Readymades (album)|Readymades]]'', Boff Whalley is seen to be reading a copy of The Manual. It is a reference to Chumbawamba's earlier success with their hit single, "[[Tubthumping]]".{{Citation needed|date=March 2007}}
[[Jamie Reynolds]] of [[Klaxons (English band)|Klaxons]] admitted in an interview to reading ''The Manual'' and stated that he "took direct instructions from it.... Get yourself a studio, get a groove going, sing some absolute nonsense over the top, put a [[breakbeat]] behind it, and you're away! That's what I did! That's genuinely it. I read that, I noted down the golden rules of pop, and applied that to what we're doing and made sure that that always applies to everything we do. That way, we always come out with a sort of catchy hit number."<ref>Sherburne, Philip. "ACKNOWLEDGE, AGREE AND REPEAT (sic)", , 24 January 2007 ([http://phs.abstractdynamics.org/2007/01/the_easy_way.html link]) {{Unreliable source?|date=July 2007}}</ref>
==Editions== *{{ISBN|0-86359-616-9}} (1988)<!-- amazon mistakenly has this as Omnibus; COPAC - British library has it as KLF Publs., hence this is the 1st edition--> *{{ISBN|1-872013-00-7}} (1989) *{{ISBN|1-899858-65-2}} (1998) *{{ISBN|3-931126-22-6}} (German version, 1998) *{{ISBN|978-80-254-6529-5}} (Czech version, 2010)
An [[audiobook]] in German language was released in 2003.
==Footnotes== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.tomrobinson.com/resource/klf.txt The Manual] - [[Tom Robinson]] ([https://web.archive.org/web/20070509073314/http://www.tomrobinson.com/resource/klf.htm Archived])
{{Bill Drummond}} {{The KLF}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Manual, The}} [[Category:1989 books]] [[Category:The KLF]] [[Category:Books by Bill Drummond]] [[Category:Books about musicians]] [[Category:Books about pop music]] [[Category:Music books]]
